It had been a difficult morning shift. The campus coffee shop was dangerously understaffed, which wasn't unusual for a Wednesday. Most of my coworkers had morning classes, and were unavailable as a result. Unfortunately, as finals week began looming over campus, we gained several new morning customers. This Wednesday, students flooded in through the door the second we had opened, and many of them had stress that overrode their compassion. The coffee shop was the busiest it had been all semester. Our supervisor helped us serve them, but couldn't do much to help contain their chaos. By the end of the shift, the clamoring of the customers had drained me of my energy and my patience.   But I still had classes to go to and finals to prepare for.   I went to the back and took off my coffee stained apron, hung it up and was ready to clock out when I caught a glimpse of the schedule for finals week.   At the beginning of the semester, I put in a request to my supervisor to have a Wednesday morning shift off for a final that one of my professors refused to let me reschedule. Even though the final was on a Wednesday morning, my supervisor approved because they were informed so far in advance.   When I saw my name listed under Wednesday morning's shift on the finals week schedule, I nearly burst into tears.   I immediately went out to find my supervisor and pulled her aside.  "This better be an emergency. Do you see how busy it is out there?"  "I'm fully aware of how busy it is out there. But I just saw my name under the opening shift Wednesday morning during finals week. I asked for that shift off four months ago."  "I don't remember that."  "I put in a request at the beginning of the semester and you approved it!"  "I don't think you ever put in a request to have that shift off. I know you're stressed because of finals week and the busier shifts, but lying to me is unacceptable."  "I'm not lying! I do have a final Wednesday morning and you approved my request to have that shift off!"  "Well, I don't have any record of it, so you better stop trying to guilt me into giving you a shift off because you didn't plan properly."  "But I did plan properly! Can you please change the schedule?"  "I'm not changing the schedule! We need you here! This shop can't run without you!"  "But I have a final, so what am I supposed to do? I can't change the date of it. I already checked with my professor at the beginning of the semester, right before I sent the request in!"  "All I know is that you better be here that morning or find someone to cover your shift. Otherwise, don't expect your job to be waiting for you when you come back."  I opened my mouth to speak, but shut it to stop myself from sobbing. My eyes had filled with tears to the point that my vision was blurry. I was going to be late to my next class.  Without another word, I grabbed my bag, threw on my coat and walked out of the coffee shop. I let tears stream down my face and sobbed as I ran to my class, snow trickling down from the cloudy skies above.

Once upon a time, there was a young woman named Sarah who had recently moved to a new city to start her dream job. She was excited about this new chapter in her life and had high hopes for what the future held.    One day, Sarah met a man named Tom at a coffee shop near her office. They struck up a conversation and hit it off right away. Tom was charming, funny, and seemed genuinely interested in getting to know Sarah. They exchanged numbers and agreed to meet up again soon.    Over the next few weeks, Sarah and Tom went on several dates and things seemed to be going well. But Sarah began to notice some strange behavior from Tom. He would make snide comments about her clothing choices, criticize her taste in music, and would often cancel plans at the last minute without explanation. When Sarah would try to bring these things up with him, Tom would dismiss her concerns and tell her she was overreacting.    As time went on, Tom's behavior became increasingly erratic. He would tell Sarah things that she knew weren't true and then deny ever saying them. He would accuse her of being forgetful or losing her mind when she tried to confront him about his lies. Sarah began to feel like she was going crazy, like she couldn't trust her own memory or judgment.    This went on for several months until Sarah finally realized what was happening. Tom was gaslighting her, manipulating her reality to make her doubt herself and question her sanity. It was a terrifying realization, but Sarah knew she had to get out of the situation.    She broke things off with Tom and sought therapy to help her process what had happened. It took time, but eventually, Sarah was able to rebuild her self-confidence and trust in her own perceptions. She learned to recognize the signs of gaslighting and vowed to never let herself fall victim to it again.    In the end, Sarah emerged from the experience stronger and more self-aware than ever before. She knew that she deserved to be treated with respect and kindness, and would settle for nothing less.

As the early morning sun peeked through the windows of the campus coffee shop, the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled the air, welcoming students to kickstart their day. Among them was Sarah, a diligent student worker, who greeted customers with a warm smile and efficiently prepared their orders.    However, Sarah's positive attitude was often overshadowed by her supervisor, Mr. Thompson, whose management style bordered on toxic. One particular incident stands out vividly in Sarah's memory.    It was a busy morning rush, and Sarah was multitasking between brewing coffee, taking orders, and restocking supplies. Amidst the chaos, Mr. Thompson approached her station, wearing his usual stern expression.    "Sarah, why is the espresso machine not cleaned properly? I specifically instructed you to ensure everything is spotless," he barked, his tone accusatory.    Startled, Sarah glanced at the gleaming espresso machine, puzzled by his complaint. She had meticulously followed the cleaning protocol earlier that morning, but she dared not argue with her supervisor.    "I'm sorry, Mr. Thompson. I'll recheck it right away," Sarah replied, her voice tinged with uncertainty.    As she began to inspect the machine, Mr. Thompson continued to hover nearby, his presence looming over her like a dark cloud. With every detail she examined, Sarah grew more bewildered. The machine was indeed clean, just as she had left it.    "I don't see any issues, Mr. Thompson. It looks clean to me," Sarah said tentatively, hoping to alleviate the situation.    Mr. Thompson's eyes narrowed as he scoffed, "Are you questioning my judgment, Sarah? I've been in this business for years. I know when something isn't done right."    Feeling a knot form in her stomach, Sarah faltered, unsure of how to respond. Gaslighting had become a familiar tactic of Mr. Thompson's, making her doubt her own perception of reality.    "I apologize, Mr. Thompson. I must have missed something. I'll clean it again," Sarah conceded, her voice barely above a whisper.    With a dismissive wave of his hand, Mr. Thompson moved on to scrutinize another area of the shop, leaving Sarah feeling defeated and demoralized. As she meticulously re-cleaned the espresso machine, doubts plagued her mind. Was she truly incompetent, or was Mr. Thompson's behavior a reflection of his own insecurities?    Despite the gaslighting tactics employed by her supervisor, Sarah remained resilient, determined not to let his toxic behavior undermine her confidence. As she continued to navigate the challenges of her job, she clung to the hope that one day, she would find the courage to confront Mr. Thompson and reclaim her sense of self-worth.
